author: guitargeek
body:
#### PR description:

Part of the occasional PFProducer PRs to make the Particle Flow code easier to grasp.

* The PFBlockProducer was a very minimal wrapper around the PFBlockAlgo class. In auch a case it does not make sense to separate them, so the PFBlockAlgo was merged with the producer
* Moving already a lot of the code around, the whole new PFBlockProducer was formatted with Davids clang-format file shown in the last reco meeting (would be done anyway at some point)
* Remove preprocessor directives
* some spurious modernization of the code
* put the QuickUnion class into its own files, as I think it's general enough to deserve that (also clang-formatted)

Observations:
* after making the links between elements a first time, the links are stored in a hash table before going after the elements a second time and updating the links. That is not really efficient. There is definitely room for speedup and improvement in this producer! Does it take a significant portion of the reconstruction time?

#### PR validation:

CMSSW compiles and matrix tests pass.
title: RecoParticleFlow/PFProducer - PFBlockProducer and PFBlockAlgo merging
